query: The Perspective on Big Data

summary.claim: Big Data is making smart societies a reality

perspectives.text: Big Data is making smart societies a reality. Institutions like MIT are using Big Data analyses to build “smart cities” that will ultimately help reduce living costs, energy consumption and harmful environmental emissions, and generally improve quality of life.

Big Data is making smart societies a reality. Saudi Arabia is using Big Data for adequate crowd control to prevent stampedes among the millions of Muslim worshippers who embark on an annual pilgrimage to Mecca.
Big Data is making smart societies a reality. The more we collect, the smarter we become.

summary.claim: Big Data is not making smart societies a reality

perspectives.text: Big Data is not making smart societies a reality. Data capture in real time broadens the scope of medical research through analysis of multiple demographics and populations.
Big Data is not making smart societies a reality. The data collected and sold by companies is not safe.
Big Data is not making smart societies a reality. An excessive amount of data can be just as confusing as having none at all.

query: The Perspective on Small-Change Investment Apps

summary.claim: Small-change investment apps make investing accessible to everyone, without breaking the bank

perspectives.text: Small-change apps make investing accessible to everyone, without breaking the bank. Slightly over half ( 58% ) of American households own stocks, with 89% of the market belonging to households that earn more than $100K or more. Investment apps allow anyone with a smartphone and some spare change to have a chance to grow their money.

Small-change apps provide a solution for lower-income Americans to save. Unlike mutual funds, most of which often require a minimum investment of $500-$5,000, these apps let you allocate mere pennies towards your investments if that’s all you have to spare.
Small-change investment apps allow people to start saving earlier, and as is the case with most saving, time will grow your stash from small change into real money.

summary.claim: Small-change investment apps may not be suitable for long-term investment goals

perspectives.text: Small-change investment apps usually restrict you to specific stocks or Exchange-Traded Funds. For long-term investment goals, such restrictions could confine your options.
Small-change investment apps will hinder you from learning the craft of investing long term and learning how to make real money by investing independently.
Small-change investment apps may not be suitable for those who want to diversify their portfolio in ways that the apps won’t allow.

Closed office space provides workers with increased physical health safety and reduces the need to appear in constant productivity, leading to less age discrimination and neurological problems.

query: Are Smart Homes a Smart Idea?

summary.claim: Smart homes can enhance people's levels of safety and security

perspectives.text: Smart homes greatly enhance people’s levels of safety. By being able to easily turn off any smart appliances from your phone–within seconds—there’s no more reason to panic when you’re out of the house and suddenly realize that you’ve left the oven on.
For greater security, you can remotely lock any home doors you forgot to lock. You can also use smart appliances to monitor your home—and your loved ones inside.
Automated technology offers peace of mind to parents about caretakers or loved ones left by themselves.

summary.claim: Smart homes can be expensive to set up and maintain

perspectives.text: It’s expensive to transform homes into smart homes. For starters, you’ll need to buy all new smart home appliances, devices, switches, and plugs to automate your lighting, climate control, security system, etc.
Smart home maintenance may also put a dent in your wallet, since digitally integrated appliances and devices are often more expensive to repair than their traditional counterparts.
This is because their technology is more delicate and prone to high-tech malfunctions, which can therefore need more frequent and sophisticated (i.e., costly) repairs.

query: Is E-Commerce Pushing Us Forward or Holding Us Back?

summary.claim: E-Commerce is pushing us forward by providing new opportunities for innovation, entrepreneurship, and economic growth.

perspectives.text: E-commerce is revolutionizing the way we shop, making it more convenient and accessible. It has also created new opportunities for small businesses and entrepreneurs to reach a wider audience.

The rise of e-commerce has led to the creation of new industries and jobs, such as data science and UX design. It has also enabled businesses to reach a global audience, increasing competition and driving innovation.

summary.claim: E-Commerce is holding us back by eroding traditional industries, creating job losses, and undermining trust in institutions.

perspectives.text: The shift to e-commerce has led to significant job losses in traditional industries, such as retail. This has had a negative impact on local communities and economies.
E-commerce has also eroded trust in institutions, such as banks and governments, by making it easier for individuals to access and share information about each other.

query: Do the benefits of crowd-sleuthing outweigh the risks?

summary.claim: The benefits of crowd-sleuthing outweigh the risks

perspectives.text: Crowd-sleuthing can make meaningful contributions to criminal proceedings, such as tracing and finding perpetrators of hate crimes and helping send murderers to jail.
Crowd-sleuthing can harness the internet's power of centralized information to provide a little extra protection for us all.
The internet seems to have a knack for convening the people with the right information in the right place.

summary.claim: The benefits of crowd-sleuthing do not outweigh the risks

perspectives.text: The likelihood of crowd-sleuths cracking a cold case is slim to none.
Crowd-sleuthing could be used for vengeance instead of virtue, leading to the spread of conspiracy theories or information that should not be in the public domain.
